column2: Twenty-First Century Fox says it could legally separate Sky News. The move would allay concerns of a British regulator about the news service's independence. Fox could sell the 24-hour news channel to Walt Disney if its bid to acquire the 61 percent of the company it does not already own is approved. Fox agreed to buy all of the European pay-TV group in December 2016, but the deal has been repeatedly delayed.
column3: The San Diego-based company said it had a loss of 27 cents per share. The results did not meet Wall Street expectations. The clinical-stage biotech company that develops stem cell treatments posted revenue of $1 million in the period.Fate Therapeutics shares have risen 80 percent since the beginning of the year. In the final minutes of trading, shares hit $11, more than doubling in the last 12 months.

column5: Telecom Italia shares rose sharply on the news on Friday afternoon. Elliott Management, an activist fund run by its billionaire founder Paul Singer, won the vote securing two-thirds of seats on Telecom Italia's board. Vivendi said in a press release that it would "take all measures necessary to preserve its value and avoid its dismantling" Vivendi owns nearly 24 percent of Telecom italia shares while on the other side Elliott Management owns just under 9 percent.
column6: Berkshire Hathaway reported a 48.7 percent first quarter gain in operating earnings, to $5.3 billion. The insurance underwriting business swung back into the green and railroads, utility and other businesses posted gains. Because of accounting rule changes that apply to its $170 billion stock portfolio, however, the conglomerate recorded a first quarter loss of $1.1 billion compared to $4 billion in last year's first quarter.

column8: Apple said it would be increasing dividends 16 percent to 73 cents per share. Apple's gargantuan net income has piled up over the years, resulting in a cash reserve of $267.2 billion as of the March quarter. Apple also said last quarter it had returned $248.4 billion in total capital to shareholders, and anticipated that figure would hit $300 billion in through March 2019.
column9: U.S. West Texas Intermediate crude for June delivery was up 11 cents, or 0.2 percent, at $68.68 a barrel by 0114 GMT. London Brent crude for new July delivery wasup 11 cents at $74.80. Trade was quiet in Asia as many markets including China, India and Singapore were closed on Tuesday for public holidays. Oil prices rose to the highest since November, 2014 in late April, driven by concern over potential disruptions to Iranian crude flows
column10: ASSA ABLOY has signed an agreement to acquire Pioneer Industries. Pioneer Industries is a supplier of steel doors and frames for commercial applications in the US. Sales for 2018 are expected to reach about USD 22 million (approx. SEK 180 million) The acquisition will be accretive to EPS from the start. The acquisition is conditional upon satisfaction of customary closing conditions and is expected to close during the second quarter of 2018.

column13: Quality Systems Inc. (QSII) reported a fiscal fourth-quarter loss of $11 million. The Irvine, California-based company said it had a loss of 17 cents per share. The provider of health care information systems posted revenue of $135.8 million. For the year, the company reported profit of $2.4 million, or 4 cents per cent, in revenue.
column14: US officials in summit planning talks at the border between North and South Korea. The talks are in preparation for a high-stakes summit between President Donald Trump and North Korean leader Kim-Jong Un."A U.S. delegation is in ongoing talks with North Korean officials at Panmunjom," spokeswoman Heather Nauert said in a statement. "We continue to prepare for a meeting between the President and North Korea leader Kim Jong Un," she said.
column15: Roku is adding voice control to its streaming products. The new feature will be available in the fall, the company says. Google and Amazon already offer voice-controlled streaming products, including the Echo and the Fire TV Stick. It's unclear what users will be able to do with the new feature, but it could be used to play music and ask questions. The feature will debut at the CES gadget show in Las Vegas.

Prices averaged around $67 a barrel in the first quarter, nearly 25 percent higher than a year earlier.

column19: European Central Bank President Mario Draghi is speaking at Frankfurt, Germany, following the central bank's decision to leave monetary policy unchanged. The central bank decided to leave its base interest rate unchanged Thursday. Its policy has been ultra-accomodative since the financial crash, but it has since moved to introduce a gradual reduction of its bond-buying program.Analysts don't expect the institution to make any significant policy announcements , despite it signaling a growing appetite for revising its policy
column20: Italy's Five Star Movement leader calls on supporters to protest peacefully. Luigi Di Maio: "Let's not give up now, we must not give in to the arrogance of the institutions" The anti-establishment group has abandoned efforts to form a coalition government with the far-right Lega. The 31-year-old leader said the group would organize peaceful walks and rallies in all Italian cities.

The company's goal is to not only be a great parts supplier, but to be a trusted business partner.

column24: FirstCaribbean International Bank Ltd is set to raise up to $240 million in its initial public offering in the United States. The bank's IPO of 9.6 million shares is expected to be priced between $22 and $25, giving it a market capitalization of $1.31 billion at the top end of the range. Parent company Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce had targeted a valuation of 10 times earnings for the potential listing.

column28: A court temporarily lifted an injunction that had been put in place at the behest of an animal rights' group. The injunction to halt the export of all live animals from Brazil was had argued that long-distance shipping amounts to animal cruelty. A federal court ruled on Sunday that the injunction should be lifted for broader ban was left in place and it was unclear how further shipments may be affected.
column29: HSBC denies wrongdoing, but settled to avoid the risks, costs and distraction of litigation, court papers show. Investors including the city of Baltimore and Yale University in Connecticut had accused 16 banks of conspiring to manipulate Libor. Banks use Libor to set rates on hundreds of trillions of dollars of credit card, mortgage, student loan and other transactions. Last July, the head of the U.K. Financial Conduct Authority said that regulator will phase out Libor by end of 2021.

column33: Current NAFTA rules require just over 60 percent of a vehicle's manufacturing to be done in the United States, Mexico, and Canada. The Trump administration has said it wants raise that to 85 percent and wants 50 percent of that to come from the U.S. Fiat-Chrysler said in early January it would shift some production of its Ram Heavy Duty truck from Saltillo, Mexico to Detroit in 2020.

column35: Mexican-American actress is a vocal campaigner against sexual harassment in the movie industry. Hayek joined dozens of other female movie makers, including Jane Fonda and Cate Blanchett, at a demonstration at the Cannes Film Festival. The issue of equality has been a running theme throughout the film festival which is the first to take place since sexual harassment allegations against some major Hollywood players surfaced last year.
column36: China is the world's biggest soybean importer and the U.S. is its second-largest supplier. China is still considering import curbs on soybeans from the United States in retaliation for moves by Washington to impose trade tariffs. The comments come from U.s. Soybean Export Council Asia Director Paul Burke. The ministry requested a meeting in Beijing with the council and it was attended by the council's China director Xiaoping Zhang.

column38: The White House released a video to address the viral hearing test "Yanny or Laurel" The audio test has listeners debating over which word is being said during the clip. Members of the Trump administration, such as Ivanka Trump and Vice President Mike Pence chimed in. But when it was President Trump's turn, he had this to say: "All I hear is 'covfefe'"
column39: Japanese and U.S. military vessels would take citizens from Busan to Japan's Tsushima island. Government officials have already visited Tsushima to inspect hotels and other potential lodging facilities. North Korea's pursuit of its military and nuclear programs in defiance of U.N. sanctions escalated tensions in 2017, which have only eased in recent weeks.Japanese Chief Cabinet Secretary Yoshihide Suga told a news conference on Tuesday that the government is always considering various scenarios.
column40: Federal Reserve vice chair for supervision Randal Quarles said the central bank is in the early stages of studying how the expanding use of machine learning in the financial sector may change its regulatory approach. He said he was hesitant to impose "bounds" on what institutions can do, rather than develop "milestones" or circuit breakers that would pause any process that was producing bad results.
column41: Square Inc. (SQ) on Tuesday reported a loss of $15.7 million in its fourth quarter. The results beat Wall Street expectations. The mobile payments services provider posted revenue of $616 million in the period. Square expects full-year earnings in the range of 43 cents to 47 cents per share, with revenue ranging from $2.82 billion to $ 2.88 billion.
column42: CoreLogic Inc. (CLGX) on Monday reported fourth-quarter profit of $64.7 million. On a per-share basis, the Irvine, California-based company said it had profit of 78 cents. Earnings, adjusted for one-time gains and costs, came to 55 cents per share.The results beat Wall Street expectations. The average estimate of seven analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of 53 cents.
column43: Novo Nordisk is the world's biggest maker of diabetes drugs. It reported first-quarter operating profit above expectations on Wednesday. It raised the lower end of its 2018 sales and profit forecast. Novo Nordisk pinning hopes for growth on new obesity drugs and a once-weekly injection and tablet version of its semaglutide drug. The company hopes that Ozempic, launched in February, will take market share from Eli Lilly's Trulicity.
column44: On , Ohio Valley Banc Corp. declared a cash dividend of $0.21 per common share. For over eight years (33 consecutive quarters), the company has maintained a consistent, regular quarterly dividend. Ohio Valley Bank is an FDIC-insured, state member bank of the Federal Reserve operating 19 offices in Ohio and West Virginia. Loan Central, specializing in tax preparation and loans, is a finance company with six offices in southern Ohio.
column45: Orbital ATK will issue a press release at approximately 6:00 a.m. (EST) on to report its fourth quarter 2017 financial results. Due to the announced acquisition of Orbital ATK by Northrop Grumman, the company will not conduct a conference call to discuss the quarterly results. Headquartered in Dulles, Virginia, Orbital ATK employs approximately 13,000 people across the U.S. and in several international locations.
column46: Chinese securities regulator to ramp up regulation of rejected "back-door listings" Companies that have their first listing rejected will have to wait at least three years before they try again. A back-door listing refers to a reverse takeover, or reverse initial public offering (IPO) It occurs when a privately-held company that may not qualify for the public offering process buys a publicly-traded company.
column47: The dancer was affiliated with Beach Blanket Babylon, a long-running San Francisco musical known for its outrageously oversized headgear. At 1,070 feet tall, the tower dwarfs other buildings in the vicinity and is the tallest office building on the West Coast. The Wilshire Grand in Los Angeles is technically taller, but includes a 166-foot spire on top, while the Salesforce Tower has no spire.
column48: The No. 2 U.S. automaker unveiled a plan to overhaul most of its lineup of vehicles. The strategy focuses on shifting attention to high-margin trucks, SUVs and performance vehicles. Toyota has been a leader in hybrids ever since it introduced the first mass-produced hybrid vehicle, the Prius, in the late 1990s. Ford expects to beat Toyota in hybrid vehicle sales by 2021, the company said Thursday.
column49: Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin says he is "cautiously optimistic" about the meeting. American officials plan to raise intellectual property rights, joint technology and joint ventures with Chinese officials. China has said it is open to trade negotiations with the United States. U.S. President Donald Trump proposed imposing tariffs on $50 billion in Chinese exports and threatened additional tariffs of $100 billion. China, in response, said it will impose its own tariffs on American products.

column51: All eight of Facebook Inc's director nominees were elected at its annual meeting. All six shareholder proposals urging reforms, including to its voting structure and content oversight, were rejected. Facebook has been under scrutiny from regulators and shareholders after it failed to protect the data of some 87 million users that was shared with now-defunct political data firm Cambridge Analytica. They did not immediately give vote tallies at the annual meeting in Menlo Park, California.
column52: Deutsche Telekom AG would receive a 42 percent stake and 69 percent of the voting interest in the combined company, sources told Bloomberg. Sources warned the deal was not final and may still fall through. The companies came close to a merger agreement in November, before SoftBank CEO Masayoshi Son pulled out after weeks of talks.Shares of Sprint are up 10 percent year-to-date.

column54: Seoul's presidential Blue House rejects criticism that next month's Winter Games will be the "Pyongyang Olympics" Some opposition politicians and conservative civic in South Korea have been criticizing North Korea's participation in the Games. "Just one month ago, acute tensions gripped the Korean peninsula," Blue House spokesman Park Soo-hyun says. Small but vocal groups of South Korean demonstrators staged a protest at Seoul's central train station on Monday where a North Korean delegation had arrived.
column55: Wesco Aircraft Holdings Inc. (WAIR) on Thursday reported fiscal second-quarter net income of $15 million. The results surpassed Wall Street expectations. The aircraft parts distributor posted revenue of $390.2 million in the period. The stock has dropped 0.5 percent in the last 12 months, while the overall U.S. stock market has increased 26 percent since the beginning of the year.

column58: Mega Millions jackpot surpasses half-billion-dollar mark for fourth time in game's history. Winning numbers were 11, 28, 31, 46, and 59 with a "mega Ball" of 1. Powerball holds the record with a $1.586 billion payout in 2016. The Mega Millions record is $656 million won in 2012, the lottery said.. The drawing follows a March 27 Mega Millions drawing that was the twenty-third in a row without a jackpot

column60: Baidu will use BlackBerry software for its self-driving open platform, Apollo. The automotive industry is one of the fastest-growing segments of the technology market. BlackBerry said it was teaming up with auto supplier Delphi on autonomous driving software in September. U.S.-listed shares of BlackBerry were up 6 percent in early trading on Wednesday. Venture capital firm Baidu says it will buy BlackBerry for $3 billion.
column61: J.P. Morgan and Wells Fargo due to report quarterly results on Friday. Fourth quarter results will come after a strong start to the year for stocks. Dow Jones industrial average cracked the 25,000 mark in the first trading week of the year. Markets globally have also seen robust gains, with the Hang Seng Index touching 26-year highs. Earnings on the S&P 500 are projected to have increased 11.9 percent in the last quarter of 2017.
column62: RingCentral Inc. (RNG) on Wednesday reported a loss of $2.7 million in its first quarter. column64: Seoul proposed holding talks with North Korea near their shared border next week. U.N. has aimed to limit the supply of oil going to North Korea in an effort to curb its nuclear and missile programs. South Korea has said it has seized two ships suspected of transferring oil to the regime in violation of sanctions. Last week, Trump sent a warning to China following reports that Beijing allowed oil to go into North Korea.
column65: Japan's economy grew at an annualized rate of 0.5 percent in the October to December period. It was the eighth straight quarter of expansion due to growth in consumer spending and capital expenditure. That marked the longest streak of growth since a 12-quarter stretch between April to June 1986 and January to March 1989 around the height of Japan's economic bubble. The preliminary reading for fourth-quarter gross domestic product compared with a median estimate of a 0.9 percent annualized increase in a

The company is also backed by Y Combinator and Founders Fund, the venture firm led by early Facebook backer Peter Thiel.

column72: Evacuation orders were issued Monday evening for anyone in the area east of Pomaikai Street to avoid being isolated by the flow. The Pacific Tsunami Warning Center on Oahu reports that a 4.4 magnitude earthquake shook the Hilina region of Kilauea volcano, southwest of the estates. Lava has oozed over two wells at the Puna geothermal power plant, but county officials said the flow stopped.
column73: Amazon.com extends its 5 percent cash back benefit for Prime service subscribers to shoppers at its newly acquired Whole Foods Market grocery chain. Amazon has been working to streamline operations at Whole Foods. Amazon's Prime service offers two-day shipping plus video streaming and other perks for $99 a year or $12.99 per month in the United States. Target Corp already offers a REDcard credit card that gives shoppers 5 percent off purchases at its own stores.
column74: Despite woes, Wells Fargo gives CEO Sloan $4.6 million raise. The bank is facing several investigations into its business, most notably its opening of millions of fake accounts without getting customers' authorization. Wells Fargo said Wednesday that Sloan made $17.6million last year, up from $13 million in 2016. While Sloan did not get a cash bonus in 2017, the value of the Wells Fargo stock awarded him rose to $15 million from $10.5 million.
column75: Israel was the first country outside the United States to acquire the F-35. In December 2016, it received the first two planes out of an order of 50. Israel says it has carried out scores of strikes in Syria against suspected Iranian emplacements or arms transfers to Hezbollah guerrillas. Its air forces is also widely believed to have operated over against Islamist militants in the Egyptian Sinai and Hamas arms smugglers in Sudan.

The latest sell-off follows reports in the last week that have raised worries about increased regulation, hackers and potential price manipulation at a major cryptocurrency exchange. The heads of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission and Commodity Futures Trading Commission are set to testify on Tuesday.

column81: The White House will hold a press conference at 1 p.m. ET on Thursday. The event comes a day after North Korea called off joint military drills with South Korea. The U.S. and South Korea are scheduled to meet for the first time since the Korean War in 1953. The meeting is expected to take place in North Korea's capital city of Pyongyang. It is unclear whether North Korea will agree to the meeting.
column82: Dana Holdings, LLC has exited its investment in Matrixx Initiatives, Inc. (Matrixx), a leading consumer healthcare business. H.I.G Capital, a Miami-based private equity firm with $24 billion of equity capital under management, acquired MatriXX in a take-private transaction in February 2011. Dana worked closely with the Matrixxx management team to implement a top-to-bottom transformation that resulted in escalating the Zicam franchise.

The company is headquartered in St. Louis and has manufacturing capabilities in North and South America, Europe and Asia. For more information, visit us at or follow us on Twitter @BeldenInc.
column84: Greco took over as CEO in 2015 after her brother Fred DeLuca died of leukemia. Under Greco's leadership, the privately held company launched a redesign with brighter atmospheres and ordering tablets in an attempt to stem a decline in sales. In February, the company changed its loyalty-rewards program, giving customers the ability to earn $2 discounts instead of free Footlong sandwiches.
column85: Comcast said Wednesday it is in "advanced stages of preparing" a "superior" all-cash offer for parts of Fox. Disney agreed in December to acquire those assets for $52.4 billion in stock. Disney's stock offer would allow Fox to spin off the assets tax-free, while a cash offer from Comcast would result in a taxable spin, sources said. A deal with Fox would boost Disney's efforts to dominate video streaming and compete with Netflix.
column86: Facebook will provide users with more stories from local sources. Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg had announced the changes in January. The changes come amid allegations that the British consultancy gained access to Facebook users' information to build profiles of U.S. voters. Facebook also faces criticism that its algorithms may have prioritized misleading news in people's feeds. (Reporting by Sonam Rai in Bengaluru; Editing by Bernard Orr)
column87: Longtime market bull Jeremy Siegel says this week's stock sell-off could evolve into a 10 percent correction. The Wharton Business School professor cited the Labor Department's jobs report as the main culprit in the Dow Jones industrial average's nearly 666-point drop on Friday. Siegel also said traders were overplaying the impact of the recent Republican tax cuts. "Will this turn into a correction, 10 percent? It could," he said.
column88: Southwest Gas Holdings, Inc. declares third quarter cash dividend. Dividend equates to $2.08 per share on an annualized basis. Company has paid quarterly dividends continuously since going public in 1956. Southwest Gas Corporation provides safe and reliable natural gas service to over two million customers in Arizona, Nevada, and California. Centuri Construction Group is a comprehensive construction services enterprise dedicated to meeting the growing demands of utilities, energy, and industrial markets.
column89: Sinclair Broadcast Group, Inc. will report its first quarter 2018 earnings results at 7:30 a.m. ET on Wednesday, . The call will be webcast live and can be accessed at under " Investors/ Webcasts ." The dial-in number for the earnings call is 877-407-8033.Members of the news media will be welcome on the call in a listen-only mode.
column90: Yale School of Management's Jeffrey Sonnenfeld said not taking a firm stance on gun control is "cowardly" and "doesn't make sense" Since the Parkland, Florida, high school shooting that killed 17 people, approximately 20 companies have cut ties with the National Rifle Association. A whopping 97 percent of Americans want enhanced background checks, according to a recent Quinnipiac University Poll.
column91: Splunk Inc. (SPLK) on Thursday reported a loss of $118.5 million in its fiscal first quarter. Losses, adjusted for one-time gains and costs, came to 7 cents per share. The results beat Wall Street expectations. Splunk shares have climbed 41 percent since the beginning of the year.. In the final minutes of trading on Thursday, shares hit $116.40, a rise of 76 percent.
column92: Hasbro said Friday its bid to have the scent trademarked was successful. "The scent of Play-Doh compound has always been synonymous with childhood and fun," Hasbro says. The musky, sweet vanilla scent with hints of cherry and salt lingered on your fingers long after you closed the cap. Few tweaks have been made to Play- Doh's recipe since its inception in 1956.
column93: Residents of New Jersey pay the highest on average at around $19,977 per year. Nine states require no state income tax, while it can run as high as 13 percent in others. West Virginia falls on the other end of the spectrum, with residents forking over only $6,837 per year, according to GOBankingRates.Below, see a glimpse at how all 50 U.S. states stack up.
column94: Bank Leumi will release its Q1 2018 Financial Results on Thursday, . Mr. Omer Ziv, First EVP & CFO, will host the results call followed by Q&A. The call is scheduled for 5 PM (Israel), 3 PM (UK), 10 AM (ET) An archived recording will be available on the Leumi website one business day after the call ends.

column97: The Board of Directors declared a regular cash dividend of 8.5 cents per share. The dividend is payable on both the Class A and Class B Common Stock, and will be paid to stockholders of record at the close of business on . Hamilton Beach Brands Holding Company is an operating holding company for two separate businesses. The Kitchen Collection, LLC is a national specialty retailer of kitchenware in outlet and traditional malls throughout the United States.
column98: Hub International Limited announced today that it has acquired the assets of Cosmo Insurance Service Corporation (CISC) Terms of the acquisition were not disclosed. CISC specializes in Property & Casualty insurance within the entertainment industry. Headquartered in Chicago, Illinois, Hub International Limited is a leading global insurance brokerage that provides property and casualty, life and health, employee benefits, investment and risk management products and services.
column99: Depomed, Inc. will release fourth quarter fiscal year 2017 financial results on Tuesday, , after the close of markets. The Company will host a conference call beginning at 4:30 p.m. EST. Participants can access the live webcast from the Investor Relations section of Depomed's website at . Please access the website 15 minutes prior to the start of the call to download and install any necessary audio software.
column100: Embraer confirmed in December that it was in discussions with Boeing over a potential deal. The Brazilian government holds a controlling "golden share" in Embraer and can veto any deal agreed. Brazil's defence minister said his government would allow a partnership or joint venture but ruled out any change of ownership to Boeing. The article also cited unnamed sources who are reportedly close to discussions and claim Boeing isn't interested in a joint venture and is only seeking a takeover.
